```{r}
# select Name, Type, Fate_Event, Notes, Lifespan, and Active_Service for Survival analysis
uboats_SA = uboats %>%
  dplyr::select(Name, Type, Fate_Event, Notes, Lifespan, Active_Service)
```
```{r}
# show the unique fates, graph by count
fate_counts = uboats_SA %>%
  count(Fate_Event) %>%
  arrange(desc(n))

fate_counts %>% ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = reorder(Fate_Event, n), y = n)) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Unique Fates of U-Boats", x = "Count", y = "Fate")
```
```{r}
# if Sunk, Scuttled, or Surrendered, then 1, else 0
uboats_SA['Status'] = ifelse(grepl("Sunk|Scuttled|Surrendered", uboats_SA$Fate_Event), 1, 0)
```

```{r}
# create a km curve
km_fit = survfit(Surv(Active_Service, Status) ~ 1, data = uboats_SA)
summary(km_fit)
```
```{r}
unique_types = unique(uboats_SA["Type"])

# graph unique types by count
type_counts = uboats_SA %>%
  count(Type) %>%
  arrange(desc(n))

type_counts %>% ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = reorder(Type, n), y = n)) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Unique Types of U-Boats", x = "Count", y = "Type")
```
```{r}
# create a km curve for each type
km_plots = list()
for (ttype in unique_types) {
  print('Survival Curve for', )
  uboats_type = uboats_SA %>% filter(Type == ttype)
  km_fit = survfit(Surv(Active_Service, Status) ~ 1, data = uboats_type)
  km_plot = ggsurvplot(km_fit, data = uboats_type, palette = "YlOrRd", risk.table = F, conf.int = T) +
    labs(title = paste("Survival Curve for", ttype), x = "Active Service (Days)")
    print(km_plot)
  km_plots = c(km_plots, km_plot)
}
```
```{r}
# for plot in km_plots display
for (plot in km_plots) {
    print(plot)
}
```
